prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Metal Plate with a Square Hole** Construct a rectangular metal plate with a square hole in the center. 1. Define a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. 2. Create the first face of the sketch: a. Draw the first line from (0, 0) to (0.75, 0). b. Draw the second line from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.35). c. Draw the third line from (0.75, 0.35) to (0, 0.35). d. Draw the fourth line from (0, 0.35) to (0, 0), closing the loop. 3. Create the second face of the sketch: a. Draw the first line from (0.1333, 0.1333) to (0.2167, 0.1333). b. Draw the second line from (0.2167, 0.1333) to (0.2167, 0.2167). c. Draw the third line from (0.2167, 0.2167) to (0.1333, 0.2167), closing the loop. 4. Create the third face of the sketch: a. Draw a circle at (0.575, 0.175), with a radius of 0.0375. 5. Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Extrude the sketch by 0.0167 units in the normal direction. 7. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation for this part. **Part 2: Prism with Cylindrical Hole** Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. 1. Define a new coordinate system with no rotation. Translate the coordinate system by (0.1333, 0.1333, 0). 2. Create the first face of the sketch: a. Draw the first line from (0, 0) to (0.0833, 0). b. Draw the second line from (0.0833, 0) to (0.0833, 0.0833). c. Draw the third line from (0.0833, 0.0833) to (0, 0.0833), closing the loop. 3. Create the second face of the sketch: a. Draw a circle with its center at (0.4417, 0.0417) and radius of 0.0375. 4. Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.4792. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.4167 units in the normal direction. 6. Perform a JoinFeatureOperation for this part. After creating these parts, you will have a final CAD model that consists of a prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. The prism will have a 45-degree angle, and the hole will be offset from the edge of the prism. The dimensions of the parts can be found in the "description" section of the JSON.</description>
